subtitle: Duck and orange make perfect partners but with a little maple syrup, the duck is sure to remain tender.

method.text: Brush the skin on each duck breast with maple syrup. Season to taste. Place under a medium preheated grill, skin side up. Grill for 10 min, making sure they do not burn. Turn and grill for 10 min until cooked through. Keep warm.

Meanwhile, blend the cornflour with a little of the orange juice until smooth. Pour the remaining orange juice, the rind, lemon juice and maple syrup into a pan. Bring to the boil then pour onto the cornflour mixture and mix until blended. Return to the heat and cook for 2-3 min, stirring continuously until sauce thickens and clears. Add the tomato puree, cinnamon, port and seasoning.
Cut the duck into diagonal slices. Serve with the sauce.

title: Duck with orange and maple syrup
